topics.body:
Hey guys, anyone here a gun enthusiast or military hobbyist? I kinda need some help. 
I'm currently looking into current existing military hardware for some fanfic, with ponies, and humans. But I really can't seem to figure out what the prevailing method of operation which sniper's and marksmen run by, besides those Youtube gun nuts and so forth. 

Anyone able to point me in the right direction? I was hoping to figure this out for the next story I've got to prepare in two or so days. Snipers and ponies FTW, also: AWM FTW! 
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Accuracy_International_AWM
topics.author: 5046d66d7f123b38980018c6

topics.body:
"@Evident Disaster":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54365a526368725d5b010200#post_54365a526368725d5b010200
Usually operates in teams of two. One spotter and one sniper. Spotter finds targets and relays info to the sniper.

topics.body:
I hate it when my fucking dad blames me for him being a complete dumbass.

Today he woke me up rushing me at 9:50 am, i didint know what for but since i was so blurred up i just followed up and took a bath and shit.

At 10:00 am i go to the computer cause i didint had classes until 12, but he comes fucking yelling at me that im a lazy piece of shit and that i should just cancel college, apparently he thought that i had classes at 10 instead.

When i told him it was at 12 (god knows why he thought otherwise) he literally screamed at me why i never told him, dispite the fact THAT WAS THE FIRST THING I TOLD HIM ONCE I GOT HOME YESTERDAY, i told him again and again but he just kept screaming the same thing "WHY DIDINT YOU TOLD ME, WHY DIDINT YOU TOLD ME".

God i can hear him upstairs complaining.
topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc

That sounds exactly like something my step dad would do. :/ Yell at you for something stupid that he forgot about and then act like _you_ didn't tell him. Even if you told him five seconds ago.
